topics.body:
I'll summarize why there's so much conflict in the world as quickly as possible since I'm waiting for a game(nvm league's servers derped hard), "war is profitable; conflict is profitable; the last thing anyone that makes money off all the conflict in the world whether it be war/murder or what have you is for it to go away thus perpetuating a every lasting cycle where nothing is really solved only reduced to certain levels when the boom cycles are unstably high"

Reason why the world is more peaceful now though, "the war economy is starting to dry up due to numerous causes but war will always exist, but not to this level and while wars and such will always exist they will become a rare occurrence and civilian deaths will continue to decline as time goes on."

The only exception is the middle east though; the middle east is just a brewing pot of conflict.

<insert revengeance quote here>

The good thing is that the people in charge are fucking stupid; there's no way that the global powers can anymore literally fucking afford to go to war with each other.  They didn't just shoot themselves in the foot, they used a bazooka on their foot.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54054ef86368723128c70000#post_54054ef86368723128c70000
the war economy is a myth. People profit off wars by making stuff for wars sure, but no evidence that they start these wars to make profits. Particularly since the most lasting way to stop war is trade. They may be able to lobby politicians who are already edging towards war but as we saw with the fears we would go to war with Syria: public opinion always overrules. 

The reasons for war are far more primitive. Taking the Middles East for example: sectarian violence and Israel.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540550d563687230e20d0000#post_540550d563687230e20d0000
Don't get excited yet; military budget cuts aren't going to be here for a couple year and it'll be a gradual wind-down.  I doubt they're just going to cut the military by say 50% in a single year, rather more realistically slowly over the course of less than two decades cut it.
